notes:
1. Definition

Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) is an international symbolic language used on engineering drawings to define and communicate engineering tolerances. It specifies the allowable variation in the geometry (form, orientation, location) of a part feature.

GD&T is used to define the functional requirements of a part. It ensures that parts will fit together and function as intended, regardless of where they are manufactured.

2. Datums and the Feature Control Frame

  • Datum: A theoretically exact point, axis, or plane from which dimensions and tolerances are referenced. Datums create a coordinate system (Datum Reference Frame) for the part.
  • Feature Control Frame: The primary tool for applying GD&T. It is a rectangular box that specifies the geometric control, tolerance zone, and datum references for a feature.

3. Categories of Geometric Tolerances

The 14 geometric symbols are organized into categories:

  • Form (Individual Features): Control the shape of a feature. They do not require a datum reference.
    • Straightness, Flatness, Circularity, Cylindricity
  • Orientation (Related Features): Control the orientation of a feature relative to a datum.
    • Perpendicularity, Parallelism, Angularity
  • Location (Related Features): Control the location of a feature relative to a datum or another feature.
    • Position, Concentricity, Symmetry
  • Profile (Individual or Related Features): Controls the 3D shape of a surface or the 2D shape of a line element.
    • Profile of a Surface, Profile of a Line
  • Runout (Related Features): Controls the variation of a circular feature as it is rotated about a datum axis.
    • Circular Runout, Total Runout

solvedExamples.question: Which category of GD&T control does NOT require a datum reference?
solvedExamples.explanation: Form tolerances (Straightness, Flatness, Circularity, Cylindricity) control the shape of a feature relative to itself. Therefore, they are not related to any other feature and do not use datums.

solvedExamples.question: What is the primary purpose of a datum in GD&T?

options.text: To specify the material of the part.
To provide a theoretical reference point, axis, or plane for other measurements.
To set the overall size tolerance of the part.

solvedExamples.explanation: Datums are the foundation of GD&T. They create a theoretically perfect coordinate system (the Datum Reference Frame) from which the location and orientation of other features are controlled.
